Crimes.Crime_Name: False or misleading information in personal information form (PIF)
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred by failing to consider reasonable explanations for discrepancies in the PIF
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found credibility issues due to unexplained discrepancies
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Personal Information Form (PIF), oral testimony, applicant explanations
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of IRPA (credibility and burden of proof)
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Plausibility and reasonableness of applicant’s explanations
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Applicant's explanations for omissions (e.g., sister’s illness, lack of border controls)
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duty to provide reasons and address all relevant evidence
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Procedural fairness and failure to address explanations
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule requiring consideration of reasonable explanations in credibility assessments
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remanded for reconsideration by a differently constituted Board
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility due to unaddressed PIF discrepancies
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Unreconciled inconsistencies in PIF without probing explanations
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to lack of analysis of explanations
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Discrepancies in dates, events, and knowledge claims
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant provided plausible justifications for omissions
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada (Federal Court review of IRB decision)
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Administrative law principles on procedural fairness and reasonableness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to engage with exculpatory explanations
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to report family member's illness and police inquiries

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Credibility assessment in refugee claim involving alleged bribery
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in disregarding reasonable explanations for testimonial discrepancies
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Testimonial inconsistencies regarding knowledge of events
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Claim dismissed based on credibility findings
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish well-founded fear
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Board must consider and analyze all reasonable explanations
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to political opinion and family targeting
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Initial rejection due to credibility concerns
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Deficient due to lack of explanation
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Oral testimony, explanations for learning about sister’s illness, family actions
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Board ignored plausible explanations without analysis
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Case law on procedural fairness and credibility analysis
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Board maintained disbelief without addressing explanations
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to credibility and evidence
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Duty to provide reasoned decisions addressing all key explanations
